intro: Psychotria tayabensis var. tayabensis, commonly known as the Tayabensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
